On-site notarization for inmates at Riverside County's main downtown detention facility

Call (213) 933‑2507 Text Us

About Robert Presley Detention Center

The Robert Presley Detention Center (RPDC) is located at 4000 Orange Street in downtown Riverside and serves as one of the primary booking and detention facilities for Riverside County. The facility is operated by the Riverside County Sheriff's Department and has a capacity of approximately 1,100 inmates. RPDC handles initial booking, pre-trial detention, and court appearances for the downtown Riverside courthouse area.

The facility is named after former California State Senator Robert Presley, who previously served as Riverside County Sheriff. Its downtown location makes it one of the more accessible Riverside County facilities from Los Angeles, with a drive time of approximately 60 to 80 minutes via the 60 or 91 freeways.

Address: 4000 Orange St, Riverside, CA 92501

Main phone: (951) 955-4500

Visit scheduling: (951) 341-8888 (daily, 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM)

Operated by: Riverside County Sheriff's Department

Capacity: Approximately 1,100 inmates

Public visiting: By appointment only — call one day in advance to schedule

Visit length: Approximately 45 minutes; max 2 visits per inmate per week

Attorney/special visits: Contact the facility directly at (951) 955-4500 to schedule

Parking: Metered street parking and public structures at Lemon & 12th Street

Location: Downtown Riverside, approximately 60–80 minutes from Los Angeles

Why inmates at RPDC need notary services

  • Time-sensitive legal matters — Court deadlines, plea agreements, and filings that cannot wait until release.
  • Power of attorney — Authorizing a spouse, family member, or attorney to handle finances, property, or legal matters while in custody.
  • Real estate transactions — Signing deeds, refinancing documents, or property transfers with hard deadlines.
  • Family law documents — Divorce paperwork, custody agreements, and support modifications requiring notarized signatures.

Common Documents for RPDC Inmates

Powers of attorney & authorizations

  • General power of attorney
  • Limited or special power of attorney
  • Durable power of attorney for finances
  • Healthcare power of attorney / advance directive
  • DMV power of attorney for vehicle transfers
  • Bank and financial institution authorizations

Real estate documents

  • Grant deeds and quitclaim deeds
  • Refinancing and loan modification paperwork
  • Property sale and escrow documents
  • Lease agreements and rental authorizations

Court & legal documents

  • Declarations and affidavits
  • Divorce responses and stipulations
  • Child custody and visitation agreements
  • Probate and estate documents
  • Civil case filings and responses

Other documents

  • Vehicle title transfers
  • Business authorizations and resolutions
  • Immigration-related affidavits
  • Insurance claims and benefit forms
  • Any document requiring a notarized signature

Scheduling a Notary Appointment at RPDC

  1. Contact us with the inmate's information

    Call or text with the inmate's full legal name, booking number (if known), and a description of the documents that need to be notarized. Let us know your deadline so we can prioritize scheduling.

  2. We coordinate with the facility

    Riverside County facilities require visits to be scheduled at least one day in advance. For attorney or professional visits such as notarizations, we contact the facility directly at (951) 955-4500 to coordinate scheduling. We confirm the inmate is housed at RPDC and not temporarily transferred before making the trip.

  3. Prepare your documents

    Have all documents ready and complete before the appointment — we cannot draft legal documents, only notarize signatures. If the inmate needs to review documents first, coordinate with their attorney or use the facility's mail system.

  4. The notary appointment

    We travel from Los Angeles to RPDC in downtown Riverside, clear security screening, and meet with the inmate in the designated visiting area. The inmate confirms their identity, signs the documents in our presence, and we complete the notarization. Valid government-issued photo ID is required for all visitors.

  5. Document delivery

    After the appointment, we return the signed and notarized documents to you, your attorney, escrow company, or other designated recipient — by hand delivery, courier, or mail depending on your timeline.

Tip: RPDC is in downtown Riverside with metered street parking and public garages at Lemon and 12th Street. Allow extra time for parking and check-in, especially during weekday court hours when the facility is busiest.

RPDC Notary Fees

Jail notarizations at Robert Presley Detention Center require travel from Los Angeles to Riverside, coordination with facility staff, security screening, and wait time. Pricing reflects the distance and complexity of working within the facility's procedures.

RPDC appointments: Starting at $300

  • Price includes travel to RPDC (4000 Orange St, Riverside), coordination, wait time, and notarization
  • Additional signatures at the same appointment may be added for a reduced fee
  • Rush or same-day appointments may have additional fees based on availability

What is included

  • Travel from Los Angeles to Robert Presley Detention Center and back
  • Coordination with facility procedures
  • Security screening and wait time
  • Notarization of documents (California notary fees per signature)
  • Return of documents to you or your designated recipient

Final pricing depends on the number of documents, any special circumstances, and timing. Call or text for a quote based on your specific situation.

RPDC Notary FAQs

Where is the Robert Presley Detention Center?

RPDC is located at 4000 Orange St, Riverside, CA 92501, in downtown Riverside. It is approximately 60 to 80 minutes from Los Angeles depending on traffic.

How do I find out if someone is at RPDC?

You can search the Riverside County Sheriff's inmate locator online or call (951) 955-4500 with the inmate's name and date of birth.

How do I schedule a visit at RPDC?

Call (951) 341-8888 between 9:00 AM and 5:00 PM daily. Visits must be scheduled at least one day in advance. For attorney or professional visits, contact the facility directly at (951) 955-4500.

What ID does the inmate need for notarization?

The facility maintains booking records that can be used for identification. If the inmate has a valid California ID, driver's license, or passport on file, that can also be used. We confirm ID options before the appointment.

Where do I park at RPDC?

RPDC is in downtown Riverside. Metered parking is available on surrounding streets, and two public parking structures are at the corner of Lemon and 12th Street.

How long does a notary appointment at RPDC take?

Plan for 3 to 4 hours total including travel from Los Angeles (60 to 80 minutes each way), security screening, wait time, and the signing.

Need notary services at a different facility?

We provide mobile notary services at jails and detention centers throughout Riverside County, Los Angeles County, and Southern California.

Other Riverside County facilities

  • Larry D. Smith Correctional Facility (Banning)
  • Southwest Detention Center (Murrieta)
  • Cois M. Byrd Detention Center (French Valley)

Los Angeles County facilities

  • Men's Central Jail (Los Angeles)
  • Twin Towers Correctional Facility
  • Century Regional Detention Facility (Lynwood)
  • Pitchess Detention Center (Castaic)
  • North County Correctional Facility (Castaic)
  • MDC Los Angeles (Federal)

San Bernardino County facilities

  • West Valley Detention Center (Rancho Cucamonga)
  • Glen Helen Rehabilitation Center (Devore)
  • Central Detention Center (San Bernardino)
  • High Desert Detention Center (Adelanto)

Not sure which jail? Call or text with the inmate's name and we can help locate them and coordinate the appointment.
